edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models
Class ObservableModel.Property<T>

java.lang.Object
  edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.ObservableModel.Property<T>
Enclosing class:
ObservableModel
public class ObservableModel.Property<T>
extends java.lang.Object

According to Wikipedia's page on properties:

A property, in some object-oriented programming languages, is a special sort of class member, intermediate between a field (or data member) and a method. Properties are read and written like fields, but property reads and writes are (usually) translated to get and set method calls. The field-like syntax is said to be easier to read and write than lots of method calls, yet the interposition of method calls allows for data validation, active updating (as of GUI visuals), and/or read-only 'fields'.
Unfortunately, Java supports neither native properties, nor operator overloading. Therefore the Property class has been provided to implement minimal accessor/mutator functionality with the least boilerplate code possible, and to allow for property-change notifications consistent with a simplified Observer-Observable pattern. When used inside a class, Property members may be declared publicly, so long as they are also declared as final. This, however, does not make a Property read-only, as just its reference—which need only be set once anyway—is read-only, not its value.

When used inside an ObservableModel, Property members will also notify their parent of any changes to their values or—if the values also extend ObservableModel—their values' Property members. These notifications may then be subscribed to- and listened to- by any and all Observers.

Author:
Cameron Behar
See Also:
ObservableModel}, {@link Observer}

suspendNotifications

public boolean suspendNotifications(boolean suspend)
Temporarily suspends the notification all of property changes to subscribed Observers. Most often this method is called when performing a large number of batch operations on a Property, so that subscribers are not overloaded with a multitude of notifications.

Parameters:
suspend - a boolean indicating whether to suspend or reenable notifications to subscribed Observers
Returns:
true if notifications were previously suspended, false otherwise

ObservableModel}, {@link Observer}, {@link ObservableList}
